entry.title: Re: External Pricing in C4C Opportunity.
entry.content: Hi KF,

entry.title: Re: SAP GUI checkbox events not received immediately
entry.content:
Hi,

there are different kinds of checkboxes in the Dynpro framework.
Some of them are so-called "Flushing" checkboxes (configuration done in the screenpainter). This kind of checkboxes causes a round-trip to the application server when their state is getting changed. The intention is that application can react immediately on this change. However, this causes additional network traffic and therefore should be avoided if not needed.
This is why most checkboxes are not "Flushing" and their status change is only sent to the server when the next round-trip is triggered for example when a button is clicked. Since SAP GUI Scripting emulates the normal SAP GUI behavior what you described is the expected situation for non-Flushing checkboxes.

Best regards,
Frank

entry.title: SAP Fiori development newsletter September2025 (issue #36)
entry.content:
With summer vacations ending for many of us and school starting the fall term, that means that we are entering conference season. Between now and the end of the year, we have SAP TechEd in Berlin and virtual, several SAP TechEd on Tour events around the world, and two SAP Fiori Innovation Days. While you can expect most of the big product announcements to happen at the larger events, we still have some innovations that you can read about below. Have you experimented with MCP servers yet? If not, what are you waiting for?

For ongoing updates, I encourage you to join our monthly SAP Fiori development roundtable. Register online or email me for an invitation.

If you prefer to receive this in your inbox, please subscribe to the SAP Fiori development newsletter.

Development news

SAP Fiori tools update – First release of the Fiori MCP Server for Agentic AI workflows

The new Fiori MCP Server offers a new capability that lets Agentic AI tools directly create and edit SAP Fiori applications. Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open standard that standardizes how applications provide context to large language models. MCP is already supported by clients such as Claude, Cline, Cursor, and VS Code, allowing AI-powered workflows to interact seamlessly with developer tools. Learn More: 
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-fiori-tools-update-first-release-of-the-sap-fiori-mcp-server-for/ba-p/14204694

SAP Build introduces new MCP Servers to enable agentic development for Enterprise Applications

Agentic AI application development is rapidly becoming an integral part of the development process, helping teams to boost productivity, reduce errors, and innovate faster than ever. With that in mind, SAP is introducing Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers to boost development with Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP), SAP Fiori Elements, and SAPUI5. Read about this open-source initiative.
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-build-introduces-new-mcp-servers-to-enable-agentic-development-for/ba-p/14205602

Open Source MCP Server can ingest SAP documentation

Marian Zeis shares his SAP Documentation MCP Server, a fast, lightweight way to give LLMs grounded access to official SAP docs, API references, real sample code, the SAP Community, and SAP Help. Less hunting through tabs, more precise answers right inside your AI tool. Read more: 
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-members/feed-sap-help-ui5-apis-amp-sap-community-content-into-your-ai-with-this/ba-p/14195007

Prevent an SAP Fiori / SAPUI5 downtime — check your browser strategy today

SAP Fiori / SAPUI5 applications in productive SAP solutions require a minimum browser version to ensure full availability and security. Learn from a recent case in SAP's customer support and make sure your business users are up to date with their browsers and operating systems. Check your browser version: 
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/prevent-an-sap-fiori-sapui5-downtime-check-your-browser-strategy-today/ba-p/14192361

How key users create consistent text changes with SAPUI5 flexibility

To tailor an app for many end users, key users can easily change e.g. the texts of standard SAP apps. SAPUI5 flexibility has a new capability to change these text and their arrangement in a consistent way, across multiple fields. See the details:
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/how-key-users-create-consistent-text-changes-with-sapui5-flexibility/ba-p/14177155

Try SAP Joule for Developers — now available for free

We have recently introduced powerful new Joule capabilities for developers across SAP Build Code, SAP Build Process Automation, SAP Build Apps, and ABAP environment. These AI features are designed to accelerate development, boost productivity, and bring intelligence into the tools you already use. Try it today:
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/unlock-sap-joule-for-developers-claim-your-free-access-today/ba-p/14183158

SAPUI5 1.138 restructures key help topics for SAP Fiori elements

With SAPUI5 1.138, the SAP Fiori elements OData V4 “Field Help” documentation has undergone a complete revamp! It’s essentially the same contents but with a much better restructuring of the key topics. The flow of topics is a lot more natural and in sync with the way the field help shows up in the UI – resulting in a far better readability of the topic. Learn more:
https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/valuehelp-docu-it-s-just-the-old-wine-in-a-new-bottle-but-then-every-bottle/ba-p/14151332

Events

Register (customers and sponsoring partners only): 
​https://events.asug.com/event/219d5e39-0d00-4534-b19e-6f0f4704de38/home

Register (customers and sponsoring partners only): 
​https://events.sap.com/eur-fiori-innovation-day-walldorf-2025/en_us/home.html

SAP TechEd registration is open

SAPUI5 and SAP Fiori development sessions at SAP TechEd Berlin

Hands-on workshops

  • AD166: Taking UI to the next level: Develop SAPUI5 with SAP Build 
  • AD260: UI extensibility on top of cloud and ABAP: What's in it for you 
  • AD163: Fusion development with ABAP Cloud in SAP Build
  • CA261: Create great UX with AI, SAP Design System, SAP Fiori elements, and SAPUI5 

Deep-dive sessions

  • AD106: The art and science of SAPUI5 in SAP Build
  • AD203: Fact-checking UI extensibility on cloud and ABAP: What's in it for you
  • CA105: Intelligent app development at scale with AI and SAP Fiori elements
  • AD201: Explore ABAP Cloud in SAP Build: What's in it for ABAP developers 

Back issues from the past year

SAP Fiori development newsletter July 2025 (issue #35)

SAP FIori development newsletter May 2025 (Issue #34)

SAP Fiori development newsletter March 2025 (Issue #33)

SAP Fiori development newsletter January 2025 (issue #32)

SAP Fiori development newsletter November 2024 (issue #31)

SAP Fiori development newsletter September 2024 (issue #30)

entry.title: Fiori VA01 WebGUI – Quantity field input lost when entering material and quantity quickly
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

we recently went live with S/4HANA and are using the VA01 transaction via WebGUI, exposed as a tile in the Fiori Launchpad.

We are experiencing a usability issue during fast order entry in the item section of VA01:

  • The sales colleague enters a material number, presses Enter, and immediately types the quantity (e.g., "100").

  • The problem is: only "00" appears in the quantity field — the first digit is lost.

  • This seems to be caused by the asynchronous loading of material master data, which overwrites the manually typed quantity.

This issue did not exist in ECC with classic SAP GUI, where fast blind typing worked fine. Our sales team needs to work quickly, entering multiple line items during customer calls, and this behavior is significantly slowing them down.

SAP support has confirmed the behavior but unfortunately stated that no correction is currently planned.

Has anyone experienced a similar issue or found a workaround?
Any suggestions (e.g. technical workaround, enhancement option, or front-end trick) would be highly appreciated!

 

 

Best regards,

ChG

entry.title: Re: Automatic Sales order exctraction
entry.content:
Dear @SKAE ,
I hope you are doing great.

The intelligent scenario SAP_COM_1129 is a SAP managed scenario, therefore, you need to request the activation of this scenario via ticket to SAP support under the component XX-S4C-OPR-SRV.

Once the scenario and default version are setup by SAP team, you can proceed with the setup according to the setup instructions: Setting Up Create Sales Orders from Unstructured Data (4X9)

If you have further questions or issues, the bellow documentation might be helpful:

  • Create Sales Orders - Automatic Extraction | SAP Help Portal
  • KBA 3452093 - Communication arrangement SAP_COM_1129 is not available
  • KBA 3542678 - Error "Connectivity with Document Information Extraction Service Instance: Connection fails." after activating scope item 4X9
  • KBA 3444900 - Not able to find the Fiori app by searching with "Create Sales Orders from Unstructured Data"

Kind regards,
Luiza.

entry.title: Re: Fiori VA01 WebGUI – Quantity field input lost when en...
entry.content:
Hello @ChG 

I guess it is related to WebGUI response time. It will always be longer than SAP GUI response time. As WebGUI needs to get a screen, analyze it,translate it to an HTML page, then the page is sent to a web browser and the browser needs to render the page. It does take time. 

You might try to optimize that - see the note 2424394 - How to investigate response times of HTTP-based front end UIs with ABAP-based backend systems However the best solution in my opinion is just to use SAP GUI, especially that the problem is not there. 

Best regards

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: Re: How to post UD for inspection lot with serial number management by using API?
entry.content:
The error message "QV / 053" indicates that a usage decision (UD) and stock posting for an inspection lot require a manual serial number assignment. This is a common issue in SAP's Quality Management (QM) module, particularly when dealing with serialized materials. The message is considered "self-explanatory" by SAP, which means there's no additional help text available directly within the system. To resolve this, you generally need to address the manual serial number assignment for the material in question. This can be done by looking up the specific inspection lot and performing the necessary steps to assign the serial numbers before completing the usage decision. In some cases, this error may be related to BAPI functions (like BAPI_INSPLOT_SETUSAGEDECISION) or specific configurations related to stock postings and serialization. Searching for SAP Notes on this specific error code (QV053) on the SAP Support Portal is a recommended step for finding a solution. If you are dealing with this in the context of an Extended Warehouse Management (EWM) environment, the problem might be linked to the interaction between the QM and EWM modules. i need figure out how to configured the QM - EWM interface...

Adilson

entry.title: Re: The upload file name is missing in object page when f...
entry.content:
Hi,

A solution that worked for me:

I extended the object page of the ROOT entity,
and overrode the client-side upload function to update the file name after uploading.

Code Snippet (Controller Extension):
Remember to change the value ​​of the following variable according to your application.
sFileNameField( "File Name" field here as it appears in the CDS).

sap.ui.define(['sap/ui/core/mvc/ControllerExtension' ],  function (ControllerExtension) {
    'use strict';

    return ControllerExtension.extend('studentapp.ext.controller.StudentObjectPage', {
        override: {
            /**
             * Called when a controller is instantiated and its View controls (if available) are already created.
             * Can be used to modify the View before it is displayed, to bind event handlers and do other one-time initialization.
             * @memberOf studentapp.ext.controller.StudentObjectPage
             */
            onInit: function () {
                //Fix bug file fame not set 
                this.getInterface().fixBugFileNameNotSet();
            },

        },

        fixBugFileNameNotSet: function () {

            if (!sap.ui.unified.FileUploader.prototype._bUploadOverwritten) {

                sap.ui.unified.FileUploader.prototype._bUploadOverwritten = true;
                var fOrignalUpload = sap.ui.unified.FileUploader.prototype.upload;
				
                sap.ui.unified.FileUploader.prototype.upload = function (bPreProcessFiles) {

                    /* Extend - Begin */
                
					//fix Bug File Name Not Set
					if (!this._bUploadCompleteAttached) {
						this.attachUploadComplete(function (oEvent) {
							var sFileNameField = "file_name", //Put here the name of your Porperty of the file name
								sFileName = oEvent.getParameter("fileName");

							this.getBindingContext().setProperty(sFileNameField, sFileName)
						}, this);
						this._bUploadCompleteAttached = true;
					}
					
                    /* Extend - End */
                    

                    fOrignalUpload.apply(this, arguments);

                };
            }
        }
    });
});

Best Regards,
Ben.

entry.title: Re: Compatibility Scope: What Happens after 2025/2030
entry.content:
Hi, 
as said in item 3 of this blog, we will inform our customers via the respective simplification item notes linked to the compatibility packages if we technically disable the features. Right now, this will only be case for the HCM topics of part 4 of our compatibility scope matrix (IDs 414 - 424) as of release SAP S/4HANA 2025 in which the business function H4S4_1 for the solution HCM for SAP S/4HANA will be set to always_on and, hence, these functions won't be available any longer. Please refer to note 3443536.
However, we will not technically disable any functionalities in already available S/4HANA releases.  Our customers must make sure themselves that compatibility packages are no longer used if use rights don't exist any longer. You could, for example, remove authorizations.

In the case of hierachy graphics in project systems, though, our PS team decided to provide a note with which customers could deactivate the menu item. Plan is to have this note ready in Q4. Please watch out for updates of note 3000979.
Regards, Stefan

entry.title: Re: Supplier quotation creation using BAPI or FM in S4 HA...
entry.content:
Hi @mvrr79 

You can create supplier quotations in S/4HANA On-Premise without using unreleased function modules by calling the standard OData service API_RFQ_PROCESS_SRV. This is SAP’s whitelisted API for RFQs and Supplier Quotations and is supported in On-Premise as well as Cloud. 

Key points:

  • Verify the service in SEGW

  • Activate the service in /IWFND/MAINT_SERVICE (search for API_RFQ_PROCESS_SRV) and assign the required roles/authorizations.

  • The API lets you create/update RFQs and Supplier Quotations, including header, item, schedule lines and conditions, via REST/OData calls.

Documentation link (On-Premise): https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/91af7f8d3acd47da90d33aaacfcd0d59/0747b64b221046a08c552f55a4b9d292.html?utm_source=chatgpt.com

Using this API you can POST the quotation header first, then items and pricing/conditions. It’s the cleanest, supported way to integrate supplier quotations with S/4HANA On-Premise.

entry.title: How to Link Custom CDS Data to a Standalone Form in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud?
entry.content:
Hello everyone:

I am currently working on setting up a standalone form in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.

This is my case:

I have created a form and linked it to the data source FDP_PP_MOR_DATA_LIST_SRV, as this form is intended to print production labels that are triggered when production is confirmed from the MES system.

I have also created a custom CDS view that combines standard fields and custom Z fields found within the MES system.

My main challenge is figuring out how to connect this CDS data to the form.

I have been exploring the Custom Fields and Logic application, but I am not sure what the correct approach is:

Custom Fields → Custom Fields

Should I implement a BAdI to expose my custom CDS fields here?

If so, could someone guide me through the steps to do this?

Custom fields → Data source extensions

How can I include my Z fields in this case?

Some specific questions:

  • Can I directly include the CDS view in either of these options?
  • Should I use both approaches (custom fields and data source extensions) together, or is there a better way?
  • Is there another recommended method to achieve this in SAP Public Cloud?

Any guidance, examples, or links to documentation would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you in advance for your help.

#SAP Forms service by Adobe   SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition   SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Manufacturing

entry.title: Everything you need to move to SAP Integration Suite
entry.content:
Introduction - Why Now Is the Moment to Modernize Your SAP Integrations

Digital leaders are defined by the ease with which they connect people, data and processes. Yet many SAP customers still rely on SAP Process Integration/Process Orchestration (PI/PO) or SAP Cloud Integration (Neo environment)— platforms that have served well for years but were designed for a very different era of IT.

Today’s reality is hybrid and multi-cloud. Applications span on-premise data centres, hyperscalers and SaaS solutions; business models evolve in weeks, not years; and customers expect real-time, event-driven experiences. In this landscape, integration is no longer a back-office utility—it is the strategic backbone that powers innovation, agility and growth.

SAP Integration Suite is SAP’s answer to this new paradigm: a modern, enterprise-grade iPaaS that unifies API-led, event-driven and process integrations under one roof. With 200-plus connectors, AI-assisted tooling, and flexible deployment options across any major cloud, it’s purpose-built to help you:

  • Retire technical debt by moving from aging middleware to a future-proof platform.
  • Accelerate time-to-value with pre-packaged integration content and proven migration tools.
  • Operate hybrid at scale—bridge on-premise systems with cloud applications seamlessly.

This blog series is a practical guide for two key audiences:

  1. PI/PO customers planning a phased or full migration from on-premise middleware to the cloud.
  2. Neo-CPI customers ready to transition their integrations to the Cloud Foundry–based SAP Integration Suite.

We offer a guided approach to holistic integration that allows you to map your own unique journey by:

  • Assess your integration strategy while defining requirements
  • Leverage proven patterns for various integration scenarios and environments
  • Define integration best practices by adopting expert recommendations
  • Gain insights and adopt agile integration practices for continuous improvement

We’ll walk through preparation, tooling, migration steps, and best practices—backed by screenshots, tips from the product team, and lessons learned from early adopters. Whether you’re charting your first pilot or orchestrating an enterprise-wide move, you’ll find everything you need to modernise with confidence and speed.

Let’s get started.

 

  1. Connect SAP and Third-Party Systems Efficiently

Whether you're connecting SAP systems or integrating with third-party applications, SAP Integration Suite provides a comprehensive, enterprise-grade integration platform as a service (iPaaS). It supports application-to-application, business-to-business, and even business-to-government integrations using modern technologies like advanced API management.

With prepackaged integrations, connectors, AI-powered tools, and business-centric APIs, you can get started quickly and scale integrations seamlessly — all while reducing manual effort and boosting efficiency.

 

  1. Accelerate Connectivity from Day One

Time-to-value is everything. SAP Integration Suite empowers you to kickstart your integration projects immediately. Thanks to its extensive library of prebuilt content, AI-supported advisors, and easily discoverable data semantics, you can reduce setup time dramatically and focus on what matters most: delivering business value.

 

  1. Enable Real-Time Business Interactions

In today’s digital landscape, real-time responsiveness is critical. SAP Integration Suite enables API-first and event-driven architectures that allow you to publish, consume, and process business data and events in real time — both within your organization and across your broader ecosystem.

This means you can power real-time insights, automation, and digital experiences that drive meaningful outcomes.

 

  1. Integrate Hybrid and Multi-Cloud Landscapes Flexibly

Modern IT landscapes are hybrid and diverse. SAP Integration Suite is designed to operate across both on-premise and cloud environments. Whether you're working in a single public cloud, multiple clouds, or a mix of on-prem and cloud, SAP Integration Suite has the flexibility to adapt.

It supports deployment on major public cloud infrastructures and offers runtime flexibility, so you can execute integrations where it makes the most sense for your business.

 

  1. Migrate with Confidence

Moving away from legacy systems doesn’t have to be risky or disruptive. SAP Integration Suite offers a clear, guided path to modern integration — supported by proven methodologies, helpful assets, and robust tools from SAP and its partners.

This means you can migrate confidently, streamline operations, and unlock the full potential of your digital transformation initiatives.

Why move to SAP Integration Suite
As a technical developer responsible for SAP PI/PO, you’re increasingly constrained by its aging, on-premise architecture and the effort required to support modern, agile, and scalable integration patterns. SAP Integration Suite offers a future-ready platform that enables you to:

  • Modernize integration landscapes with cloud-native, microservice-based tools
  • Accelerate time-to-value through hundreds of pre-built integrations, APIs, and templates
  • Support hybrid and multi-cloud strategies with out-of-the-box connectors for SAP and non-SAP workloads
  • Embrace API-first and event-driven approaches for real-time responsiveness, reduced coupling, and easier extensibility

 

 Introductory Assets

Why do I need this assets?

Article: Producing tangible business benefits from modern iPaaS solutions by MIT Technology Review

Website: Smoothly transition to the cloud from SAP Process Orchestration

 

These introductory assets discuss why modern iPaaS solutions, like SAP Integration Suite, offer significant business benefits by streamlining and accelerating application integration through pre-built connectors, automation, and AI-enabled features for tasks like code analysis and testing, ultimately facilitating a smooth, strategic transition from legacy systems like SAP Process Orchestration while boosting agility and efficiency.

Technical Documentation

Why do I need this assets?

Migration Guide for SAP Process Orchestration

Integration Flow Design Guidelines

The technical documentation guides users through migrating from SAP Process Orchestration to SAP Integration Suite, covering assessment, migration steps, and best practices for designing integration flows in the new cloud-based environment, with a focus on connectivity, security, and error handling.

 Blogpost

Why do I need this assets?

Elevate from SAP Process Orchestration and Modernize your integration platform with SAP Integration Suite

Accelerate move to SAP Integration Suite with SAP Integration Suite Testing Service

These blog posts provide information about the strategic imperative and practical aspects of migrating from SAP Process Orchestration to SAP Integration Suite. They discuss the use of automated testing and migration tools to accelerate the transition, minimize risks, and ensure a smooth go-live.

Devtoberfest Sessions

Why do I need this assets?

Migrating to SAP Integration Suite with Int4 Shield

Successfully plan, prepare and execute your migration to SAP Integration Suite with Figaf

Partner Webinars:  https://events.sap.com/modernizationjourneywithpartners/en_us/home.html

 

These sessions focus on how to successfully plan, prepare, and execute a migration from SAP Process Orchestration, emphasizing the critical role of automated testing and migration tools like Int4 Shield and Figaf to reduce complexity, risk, and manual effort.

 Tutorials from SAP Tutorial Navigator

Why do I need this assets?

Use the Migration Assessment Application

How to migrate RFC Lookups from SAP Process Orchestration to Cloud Integration

Learn how to migrate JDBC Lookups from SAP Process Orchestration to Cloud Integration

Learn how to migrate SFTP Advanced File Selection from SAP Process Orchestration to Cloud Integration

These tutorials collectively teach how to leverage the Migration Assessment Application to plan and execute the migration of various integration scenarios (specifically RFC Lookups, JDBC Lookups, and SFTP Advanced File Selection) from SAP Process Orchestration to SAP Cloud Integration, including practical steps and considerations for each type of migration.

 Learning Journey

Why do I need this assets?

Migrating to SAP Integration Suite


Developing with SAP Integration Suite

 

The learning journeys equip integration designers and developers with the knowledge and skills to successfully migrate integration scenarios from legacy SAP Process Orchestration/Process Integration to the modern SAP Integration Suite.

 Discovery Center Mission

Why do I need this assets?

Get Started with Migration to SAP Integration Suite

Automate the Migration from SAP Process Integration to SAP Integration Suite with Figaf 

These missions include best practices and step-by-step guidance for use case implementation, supported by mission experts and SAP Community.

 

Why move to SAP Integration Suite
As a technical developer using SAP CPI on the Neo environment, you face architectural and operational limitations that hinder modern integration demands. With SAP’s strategic shift to the Cloud Foundry-based SAP Integration Suite, now is the time to evolve and future-proof your integration capabilities:

  • Leverage a modern, flexible runtime based on Cloud Foundry with greater scalability and resilience
  • Access the full capabilities of SAP Integration Suite, including enhanced API management, event mesh, and open connectors
  • Simplify operations with improved lifecycle management, monitoring, and DevOps-friendly tooling
  • Adopt hybrid integration strategies with support for cloud, on-premise, and third-party systems

 

Introductory Assets

Why do I need this assets?

Free assessment for SAP BTP, Neo environment

 

Access this free service to assess your current SAP BTP, Neo environment implementation; plan your migration to the multicloud environment; and develop a migration plan.

Technical Documentation

Why do I need this assets?

SAP Cloud Integration Migration Guide

Use this guide to transfer your integration scenarios in the Cloud Integration tenant from the Neo environment to SAP Integration Suite in the Multi-Cloud Foundation.

Blogpost

Why do I need this assets?

Migrate from Neo to Cloud Foundry - SAP Cloud Integration

This blog highlights the process with some screen shots of migrating integrations from a Neo tenant to Cloud Foundry tenant

 Learning Journey

Why do I need this assets?

 

Modernizing Integration with SAP Integration Suite

This course offers a concise yet comprehensive introduction to SAP Integration Suite, covering the key capabilities, the importance of a defined enterprise-wide integration strategy, and how you can leverage AI to modernize your business landscape.

 

Thank you very much for tuning into the blogpost. We hope that those assets will help you to accelerate your journey to the next-gen integration platform SAP Integration Suite. Plese keep in mind that moving from PI/PO or Neo-CPI is not simply a ,,lift & shift" but it is a journey to a modern way to connect business processes and applications across your enterprise.

Big thanks to Kristin McMahon and Ryan Champlin for co-authoring this blogpost!

entry.title: Re: Change Field Type of field AENNR (Change Number) from...
entry.content:
Hi Kerisha,

Unfortunately, as this is a standard field you likely cannot change the field type for the app.

What you can investigate is the configuration of the Change Record Types in SSCUI 102380:

From the documentation:

"

Use

In this Customizing activity, you can define engineering change record types and settings specific to each change record type.

Change Record Types

You define change record types and settings specific to each change record type.

CR Number Range: One of the number ranges that you have defined in the Define Number Range Intervals for Change Records Customizing activity.
Status Profile: One of the status profiles that you have defined in the Define User Status Profiles Customizing activity.

"

You should be able to define the number ranges for the CR for example.

Change Management in the help: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/f369b2eff700401494ba6e7c9a573288/d1c63dbe742b45ad98efa0e726da74a5.html?version=LATEST&locale=en-US

Getting Started with Change Records: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/f369b2eff700401494ba6e7c9a573288/cc6acb33a7c04b2a92663ae75a9146b3.html?version=LATEST&locale=en-US

 

Please note that the Change Material Revision Level app is deprecated, per the Fiori library.

https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/index.html#/detail/Apps('CC12')/S35

If you could provide more detail about your business requirement, we might be able to provide additional guidance.

Thank you

Jerry

entry.title: Unable to Select Structured Type Property in CDS Entity
entry.content:
Hello 

I defined a new type in the CDS service as follows:

type MyNewType {
    prop1 : String;
    prop2 : String;
    prop3 : String;
}

I then used this type in a property within an entity like this:

entity MyEntity {
    period     : String;
    resolution : String;
    properties : MyNewType;
}

However, when I try to select this property using $select=properties, the framework returns an error.

{
    "error": {
        "code": "400",
        "message": "The property 'properties', used in a query expression, is not defined in type 'MyEntity'."
    }
}

I don't see any issue with my declaration. Could you please help me identify and resolve the problem?

Thanks !

entry.title: Enhanced Validation for Concurrent Employment and Global Assignment Conflicts - 2H 2025
entry.content:
As part of our ongoing efforts to ensure data consistency and data quality we have added validation to avoid concurrent employment and global assignment conflicts. 

As of 2H 2025 when adding a global assignment to an employee with a concurrent employment the system will show a validation warning about the two conflicting employments:

The same will apply if you add a concurrent employment to an employee on a global assignment:

Why are we doing this?

As per our implementation guide, a global assignment and a concurrent employment cannot be applied to the same employee at the same time (Types of Employment | SAP Help Portal) .  We are introducing this change to ensure the system and documentation are aligned and to reduce the possibility of data inconsistencies. 

What do you need to know?

The validation will come into effect in 2H 2025 if you try to add an active concurrent employment and global assignment at the same time.

This change will not impact employees who already have active concurrent employments and global assignments which exist at the same time. 

This change does not impact on future dated records, for example, an employee has a concurrent employment which ends on 31st December and they go on a global assignment on 1st January

We have introduced the validation as a warning message to give customers time to adjust their processes accordingly. It is planned in 1H 2026 to change the validation warning to an error. If you have a business scenario which allows an employee to have a concurrent employment and global assignment at the same time, you will need to adjust your processes accordingly to prepare for this change.

Please feel free to reach out and leave a comment below this blog post if you have any questions or need further clarification on this process. Your feedback is always welcome!

entry.title: Re: BAdI/User Exit for Billing Document Creation (VF01 –...
entry.content:
The key challenge here I could see is in S/4HANA Cloud, workflow events are typically raised after the document is saved, because business events like BillingDocument.Created are published post-commit. However, your requirement is to intervene before final save, so the document goes for approval before completion.

Some recommended approaches can be

Enable Flexible Workflow for Billing Documents and check if Billing Document Workflow Scenario is available in your system (via Fiori app Manage Workflows for Billing Documents). If not available, consider using Custom Business Object or Developer Extensibility.

Configure the workflow so that when a billing document of type RE is created, it enters a draft or pending approval state. The workflow is triggered before final posting. This ensures the document is not finalized until approved.

If standard workflow doesn’t support pre-save interception, use BAdI SD_BILLING_DOCUMENT_PREPARE available via Custom Logic App in Fiori. You can raise a custom event or set a flag to block save until approval.

entry.title: How to Handle Cross-Global Account Subscriptions and Customer-Managed HANA in CAP SaaS?
entry.content:
A SaaS solution built using SAP CAP (Node.js) with MTX-enabled multitenancy is currently running in production with several subscribed tenants (subaccounts under the same global account).

The solution is deployed as an MTA in a provider subaccount, while each customer has a dedicated subscriber subaccount to consume the application.

HANA setup

At the moment, I use a shared HANA Cloud database. The MTX sidecar creates a Service Manager HDI container for each tenant, and together with the CDS framework, it handles multitenancy properly.

Customer concern

One customer raised data privacy concerns, since the solution connects to their S/4HANA system (via Cloud Connector) and stores data in our HANA Cloud.

My questions

Part 1: Is it possible for a customer to subscribe to the SaaS application from a subaccount in a different global account (not the same global account as the provider subaccount)? I am particularly thinking about potential XSUAA-related challenges here.

Part 2: Is it possible to support a “bring your own HANA” (BYO HANA) model, where the CDS framework would connect to a customer-managed HANA instance instead of the shared one?

I understand this may be a stretch given the current state of CAP applications, but I’d appreciate any insights into what SAP offers in terms of architectural possibilities and limitations in this area.

Thank you !

entry.title: Re: SAP Build Apps JS Problem
entry.content:
Hello there, this seems to be a js syntax mistake rather than an issue with the custom js block in SAPBA. 

You return your value as `return { myObj }`. Which if you would log that to the console result in the following structure: 

```

{ "myObj": { "urgency": "", ...  } }

```

Instead of your expected output where you defined a structure like: 

```

{ "urgency": "", ... }

```

So the proposed solution is to replace your `return { myObj }` with the `return myObj` line simply. 

However, let me give a few more tips here on the custom js in SAPBA, for things like this, you probably would have been better off with using a 'set app variable' function with a formula like this: 

```

DECODE_JSON(appVars.aiInput[1].content.urgency)

```

By doing it with the filters instead of js you spare yourself some of the tricky aspects of the custom js. 

Lastly, if you really want to use the custom js, then note the following: 

1. The output is most robust if returned as an array of objects (list of objects), e.g. `return [0, myObj]`. Why? Because in SAPBA there is the possibility to define multiple outputs from the cutom JS, e.g. one for success, one for error, one for default output etc. You can see prime examples of this with essentially any data related logic item in SAPBA. 

2. Master the output schema definition. They way you defined the output is just right, to make the best use of the custom js, one has to be good at defininng the variable schemas in SAPBA, especially when it comes to list of things. 

3. Best practice, rename the input properties to something you will remember and understand in the future. Every property that you define on the left side will become a property of the `inputs` object. You are accessing it via the `inputs.input1` path, which is fine, but a slightly more readable and maintainable option would be to do the following: `const { input1 } = inputs;` This destructuring helps in making sure you have more readable and maintainable code, as you would reference this new variable instead of the inputs object always. Just imagine if you would have here a 40-90 line js block and would need to find a typo... 

 

Hope this helps and good luck with SAPBA.

entry.title: 🟣 Extend Fiori UIs in SAP Build: Empowering Adaptation Projects with Generative AI Capabilities

This session will guide you through the practical process of starting an adaptation project directly from S/4HANA Cloud via SAP Build Extensibility Wizard, using SAP Build AI to generate XML and controller extensions, and deploying the application variant back to S/4HANA Cloud.

 

Speakers

In sales different rebate recipients are possible. I assume that the same is possible for purchasing rebates. Within the customizing of the condition contract type change the setting "Type of contract partner" to "No contract partner". You find further information about this in the documentation for "Sales Rebates". Search for "Multiple Customers", respectively condition contract type 0S02.

You find the relevant documentation in the following SAP Notes:

  • 2564353 - Condition Contract Management: Product Overview Documents - SAP for Me

entry.title: Extensibility Custom Field - Professional services - Project billing - PDR to BDR
entry.content:
I have a requirement to Create a custom field in (Professional services -> Project billing cycle ) using Manage Project billing App, the Target is to transfer Data from Project Billing Request ( PDR ) to Billing Document Request ( BDR ) and I have added the fields successfully into project billing and billing request Documents, but the data is not transferred from PDR to BDR

I have followed this blog:  influence-resource-related-billing-through-extensibility-from-journal-entry 

I have created a custom field in the Accounting Coding Block to be visible in the manage project billing App and enabled business scenario Coding Block to Billing Document Item for Project Billing

  1. Three more fields got Created for the following business context
    1. Entries for Project Billing Element (PROJECT_BILLING_ELEMENT_ENTRY) :
      • enabled business scenario -> Coding Block to Billing Document Item for Project Billing 
    2. Items for Project Billing Request (PROJECT_BILLING_REQUEST_ITEM):
      • enabled business scenario -> Coding Block to Billing Document Item for Project Billing 
    3. Sales: Billing Document Item (SD_BILLINGDOCITEM) :
      • enabled SAP GUI User interface so that the value be visible on billing request UI

I filled the custom field value in the manage project billing accounting document entry item level and the data is saved in PDR successfully but not transferred to BDR

entry.title: Re: Can't create Transport Request for my new ABAP Cloud...
entry.content:
This is a change in ABAP Cloud Release 2508. It is no longer possible to create transport requests for packages in software component ZLOCAL (which includes having ZLOCAL as a superpackage). 
It is a logical change, as local developments are not intended for transport, and brings the use of ZLOCAL in line with the use of the analogous package $TMP in on-premise systems, where change recording was also not enabled.

entry.title: 🟣 Introducing Application Frontend: Simplifying UI App Hosting
entry.content:
In this session, we’ll introduce the Application Frontend service, a new SAP-managed solution designed to simplify how developers host, manage, and deploy web-based UI applications. Built on an API-first paradigm, the service offers full control via REST APIs and CLI tooling, enabling seamless integration into modern development workflows. After a short into explaining the main concepts, we will showcase the key capabilities of the service like version management, deployment options, testing by demoing an e2e application development flow.

Speakers

  • Nachshon Vagmayster, SAP
  • Tahel Milstein, SAP
  • Vadim Tomnikov, SAP

entry.title: Re: How to pay Electricity Bill in SAP
entry.content: I am a little content writer.

entry.title: Re: End-to-end Testing in Peppol Exchange Service
entry.content:
Dear SAP Gurus, 

I tried sending Einvoices (FI and SD) to myself as described, but I still cannot see the incoming invoice in the Edoc_cockpit. In our DRC "Peppol exchange" APP,  our Peppol Network Status is only "Send Enabled", I could not find where to config "Send and Receive Enabled". Anyone knows the answer, will be really appreciated. 

Thanks and best regards, 

Ting

entry.title: 🟣 AI + SAP Fiori elements = Intelligent App Development at Scale
entry.content:
With exciting updates to building blocks, a streamlined entry page, and powerful generative AI in SAP Fiori tools, developers can build applications faster than ever. Get a first look at how we integrate MCP to orchestrate AI capabilities across SAP Fiori tools and SAP Fiori elements for faster app development.

Speakers

  • Sebastian Werner, SAP
  • Stefan Engelhardt, SAP
  • Christoph Gollmick, SAP
